fields.content: no one knows how the first moon was born, but it is known that every time someone says the word firefly, in any place, at any time, then the moon waits for this rare moment where all of the creatures on the planet, at least those with eyes, when all of them blink simultaneously. at this moment the moon disappears, and a new moon is born to replace it. sometimes, a creature would open their eyes just a fraction of a millisecond before everyone else does, and if that creature is lucky, and it happens to be nighttime where they’re at, and if they happen to be looking up, and if they have that special sensibility that lets them notice this type of important things, then they see the moon blink in the sky, like a firefly.

there is a boy who only is when the moon is one day old. on all other days, the boy can not be seen, but on these nights, when the moon is just a faint thin sliver, then the boy continues his existence, just like that. he always examines the moon as soon as he appears, and he notices the tiniest differences in the way the moon looks. the boy knows that he has another kind of life to live. he eats big meals that would last him for four weeks at a time. he tries to make friends that will understand his special situation. he asks them to describe the way the moon looks like on other nights. they don’t understand why he is so interested in that and tell them about their troubles instead. he listens carefully.

there was once a land that had a kingdom that had a court that had a judge that decided to send a prisoner to spend the rest of her life on the moon. after the verdict was made, they realized that they do not know how to transport people to the moon. however, the decision was made and it had to be executed. they used all of their resources to research the matter, and after years of work, they finally managed to build a spaceship that will fly the prisoner to the moon. after the successful take off, they were left poor and unable to support all of their other needs, and the prisoner was happy to leave such a place.

sometimes there are actually many many moons in the sky. it’s a wonder that none of them clash in their orbit around the earth. the number of moons is so big no one can count it. it’s much more than the number of stars in the sky, and it’s a known fact that that is quite a lot to begin with. in fact, there must be one moon per creature living on earth. the odd thing is that each creature only sees their own moon, and not the billions and billions of other moons. occasionally some creatures are born with the ability to see other moons. some creatures manage to see them all in their old age.

one time, a very short kid got tired of not reaching high places and not seeing what things looked like from above. she decided to build trampolines all the way along from her house to school. walking turned into skipping and the kid was happy. she loved skipping in this way so much that she placed more and more trampolines wherever she went. soon enough there were trampolines circling the entire planet! one day, the kid started skipping. she skipped faster and faster. higher and higher. one moment she sees treetops and roofs. another moment she is above mountains and in the clouds. she kept going higher and higher. all of a sudden she felt something strange. she was no longer falling down, instead she was thrusting forward in immense speed. she was now flying around the earth. she got so scared that she started to expand and grow. she grew so much she could not recognize herself anymore. she felt the warmth of the sun on her back. she saw the way she illuminated the shadowy parts of the earth.

just like humans, so do animals and plants tell stories about the moon. different phases are more important to certain animals than others. when the moon is almost about to start a new cycle, it  is a night of particular interest to raccoons. on this night, the raccoon, who is a natural loner, changes its behavior. when the moon is 27 days old, the raccoons gather at night and perform a ritual together. all of the raccoons gather together. they wiggle their snouts, and jump on top of each other, forming a tower of chubby nocturnal creatures. in good months, when many raccoons are not too busy, the tower is so tall, that the raccoon on top gets to touch the moon and ask for a wish. on these rare opportunities when a raccoon touches the moon, they usually ask for simple things, like a biscuit or a bag or good quality leaves. the almost always get it.

a moon that is about to disappear is a sad moon. it shines almost no light. it floats in its place, stares at the stars that are twinkling around it in the darkness and wonders about the important things in a moon’s life; was there ever or will there ever be water in me? what will happen to me without an anchor, when the earth disappears? will i have any moons of my own then? will they love me as much as i love them?
